case_studies.name: Mahakumbh 2024 Stampede
case_studies.cause: Gate malfunction at Sangam (confluence of rivers)
case_studies.official_trigger_description: Temporary barrier at Sangam bathing ghat gave way. Pilgrims rushed forward without alternate entry. Single exit bottleneck.

trigger.description: Barrier at Sangam collapsed, blocking primary exit

cascade_factors: Auspicious time (Mauni Amavasya) - deadline to take holy bath
Estimated 80+ million people in the area
Multiple gates/entrances but only one Sangam (confluence)
Many elderly and infirm pilgrims (religious significance)
No alternate bathing routes available
Emergency protocols not activated in time

actions_taken: T=180s: CRITICAL - Gate malfunction detected. Close Sangam entry immediately.
T=185s: Activate emergency exits (East, West sides). Broadcast: 'Use alternate routes'
T=190s: Reduce inflow by 80% through main entrance. Divert to side gates.
T=200s: Reroute 50% of pilgrims to alternative bathing areas (Triveni steps).
T=210s: Medical teams deployed to exit zones. PA system: Calm evacuation.

key_lessons: Single-exit design is FATAL in high-density crowds
Backup routes must be pre-publicized and ready
Time pressure (auspicious deadline) overrides safety for pilgrims
Emergency alert systems need to broadcast IMMEDIATELY
No human coordination system can react fast enough - NEED AI
Alternate bathing areas could have distributed crowd

case_studies.name: Mahakumbh 2013 Stampede
case_studies.cause: Stampede at bathing ghat, crowd surge
case_studies.description: Crowd surge at bathing area when pilgrims rushed forward. Multiple people fell, triggering panic.
cascade_factors: Earlier riot (same day) caused fear among pilgrims
Rumors of more trouble spread
When actual surge began, panic amplified exponentially
Limited space at bathing ghats
Police cordons created bottlenecks

case_studies.name: Itaewon Stampede - Seoul
case_studies.description: False information about celebrity appearance spread. Crowds surged into narrow alley. High density + no exits = stampede.
cascade_factors: Misinformation spread via social media
Crowd moved FROM wide area INTO narrow alley (REVERSED FLOW)
No PA system to counter rumor
Police didn't understand severity until too late
Heavy crowd in darkness (evening) = limited visibility
Age group: younger (20s-30s) more susceptible to rumors

actions: T=120s: AI detects density spike in narrow alley (4.2 p/m²)
T=125s: Broadcast 'STAND FAST' repeatedly via PA + phone alerts
T=130s: Deploy personnel to side streets to calm crowd
T=135s: Counter-message: 'Celebrity appearance is FALSE. Stay in wide area.'
T=140s: Redirect crowd OUT of alley - open parallel routes
T=150s: Close alley entrance if density >5.0 p/m²

key_lessons: MISINFORMATION is as deadly as physical events
Counter-information must be IMMEDIATE and AUTHORITATIVE
Social media can't beat on-site PA system
Narrow spaces are DEATH TRAPS - avoid them when possible
AI can detect rumor-spread faster than humans

case_studies.name: Vijay Thalapathy Political Rally Stampede
case_studies.description: Security closed gates due to overcrowding. Crowd pushing from behind didn't know gates were closed. Crush on closed gate.
cascade_factors: Unexpected gate closure without warning
No communication to crowd
Continued pushing from people behind
Gates became immovable barrier
No alternate routes communicated

actions: T=100s: AI predicts gate closure needed (density 4.1 p/m²)
T=105s: BEFORE closing, broadcast 'GATES CLOSING. Use alternate exits.'
T=110s: PA announcements EVERY 5 seconds redirect crowd
T=115s: If crowd doesn't disperse, close gates GRADUALLY (not suddenly)
T=120s: Medical teams positioned at predicted crush point

case_studies.name: RCB Stadium Infrastructure Incident
case_studies.description: During national anthem, crowd's synchronized swaying caused bridge to vibrate. Perception of danger → panic surge. Crush injuries from people rushing exits.
cascade_factors: Structural resonance from synchronized crowd movement
Visible vibration created fear
Panic spread even though no structural failure occurred
Unsupervised exit attempt
Multiple people tried to leave simultaneously

with_monitoring: T=0s: AI monitors vibration sensors on bridge
T=5s: Detects amplitude increase during anthem
T=8s: Broadcasts 'Structure is SAFE. Stay calm. No evacuation needed.'
T=10s: Authoritative voice (stadium official) confirms safety
T=15s: Crisis averted - panic prevented before it starts

common_triggers.lesson: Single exit = DEATH. Multiple exits required.
Information spreads faster than fact. Control narrative immediately.
common_triggers.ai_helps: Detect rumor spread → counter with PA system

common_triggers.lesson: One person falls → cascade. Prevent first fall.
common_triggers.ai_helps: Detect early signs of instability → deploy medical

common_triggers.lesson: Perception matters. Reassurance from authority is critical.

key_factors: Immediate communication beats slow human coordination
